title: git config
description: The git config command configures the author name and email address to be used with your commits.

description.title: git reflog
description.description: This command allows you to list all the commands that were executed and then recover particular commits.

description.title: git init
description.description: The git init command creates a new Git repository. It can be used to convert an existing, unversioned project to a Git repository or initialize a new, empty repository.

description.title: git clone
description.description: The git clone command creates a working copy of a local repository.

description.title: git add
description.description: The git add command adds a change in the working directory to the staging area. It tells Git that you want to include updates to a particular file in the next commit.

description.title: git commit
description.description: The git commit command captures a snapshot of the project's currently staged changes.

description.title: git merge
description.description: The git commit command joins two or more development histories together.

description.title: git log
description.description: The git commit command provides a log of changes made throughout time.

description.title: git show
description.description: The git commit command shows one or more objects (blobs, trees, tags and commits).
description.title: git tag
description.description: The git commit command provides Tags are ref's that point to specific points in Git history. Tagging is generally used to capture a point in history that is used for a marked version release .

description.title: git branch
description.description: The git branch command is used to make a new branch. It can also be used to delete or list the existing branches of your repository.

description.title: git checkout
description.description: The git checkout command is used to switch the working branch by pointing the HEAD to the branch you choose for.

description.title: git clone
description.description: The git clone is used to make a clone or copy of the repo in a new directory,or at another location. The original repository can be located on the local filesystem or on remote.

description.title: git remote
description.description: A remote in Git is a common repository that all team members use to exchange their changes. In most cases, it is stored on a code hosting service like GitHub or on an internal server.

description.title: git stash
description.description: It is used to record the current state of the working directory and the index, but want to go back to a clean working directory, so it amends a dirty working directory.

description.title: git stash apply
description.description: This command try to reapply the staged changes

description.title: git stash pop
description.description: This command applies the changes to the local workspace in the latest stash.

description.title: git stash drop
description.description: This command remove a stash entry from the list of stash entries.

description.title: git stash list
description.description: Enlists the stashes made with the recent one in the top.

description.title: git config
description.description: This command sets the author name and email address respectively to be used with your commits.

description.title: git pull
description.description: This command lets you fetch changes from a remote repository and merge it into the current branch.

description.title: git diff
description.description: This command shows how one branch (or even a specific revision) differs from another one.

description.title: git --version
description.description: Prints the Git suite version that the git program came from.

description.title: git rm
description.description: This command deletes the file from your working directory and stages the deletion.

description.title: git send-email
description.description: This command sends a collection of patches as emails.

description.title: git push
description.description: This command lets you push changes from your local repository to the remote repository.

description.title: git rebase
description.description: This command moves or combines a sequence of commits to a new base commit

description.title: git reset [file]
description.description: unstage a file while retaining the changes in working directory.

description.title: git reset --hard
description.description: unstage all files while retaining the changes in working directory.

description.title: git status
description.description: The git status command lists all new or modified files to be committed.

description.title: git clean
description.description: Removes untracked files from the working tree

description.title: git stash list
description.description: Enlists the stashes made with the recent one in the top.

description.title: git cherry-pick
description.description: Apply the changes introduced by some existing commits.

description.title: git show
description.description: This command shows the metadata and content changes of the specified commit.

description.title: git rebase --abort
description.description: This command is used to cancel an interactive rebase.

description.title: git cherry-pick
description.description: This command copies the commit to the current branch.

description.title: git worktree list
description.description: Manage multiple working trees attached to the same repository.

description.title: git shortlog
description.description: Summarizes git log output in a format suitable for inclusion in release announcements. Each commit will be grouped by author and title.

description.title: git grep [pattern]
description.description: This command print lines matching a pattern.

description.title: git reset hard
description.description: Go back to the last commit.

description.title: git archive
description.description: Create an archive of files from a named tree.

description.title: git bundle
description.description: Move objects and refs by archive.

description.title: git fetch
description.description: Downloads all history from the repository bookmark.

description.title: git merge
description.description: Git merge will combine multiple sequences of commits into one unified history. In the most frequent use cases, git merge is used to combine two branches.

description.title: git fetch
description.description: Fetch/download changes from a remote repository to the local repository without merging them with the current branch.

description.title: git diff
description.description: This command shows the file differences which are not yet staged.

description.title: git mv
description.description: Move or rename a file, a directory, or a symlink.

description.title: git log --oneline
description.description: Provides a summary/log of changes made in the repository in oneline.

description.title: git bisect
description.description: Use a binary search algorithm to find the commit that introduced a defect.

description.title: git status
description.description: The git commit command provides a status of changes made throughout time.

description.title: git reset
description.description: The git reset command is a complex and versatile tool for undoing changes. It has three primary forms of invocation. These forms correspond to command line arguments --soft, --mixed, --hard. The three arguments each correspond to Git's three internal state management mechanism's, The Commit Tree (HEAD), The Staging Index, and The Working Directory.

description.title: git status
description.description: The git status command shows the state of your working directory and helps you see all the files which are untracked by Git, staged or unstaged.

description.title: git reflog
description.description: This command manages the information recorded in the reflogs.

description.title: git fetch
description.description: Gathers any commits from the target branch that do not exist in your current branch but does not merge them with your current branch.

description.title: git gc
description.description: Cleanup unnecessary files and optimize the local repository.

description.title: git rev-parse
description.description: Shows the hash of current commit you're on.

description.title: git switch
description.description: Switch to branch.
